critique: This document is an executive order delegating presidential authority to department and agency heads regarding certain actions by government employees. It does not directly address ideological issues, immigration, or economic regulation. It is primarily concerned with the internal organization and delegation of power within the executive branch. The order appears neutral on social inclusion and national security vs. civil liberties. It could be argued that delegating authority slightly restrains executive power at the presidential level, but it also empowers agency heads. It does not obviously favor state or federal primacy.
